goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions

Class InvalidSemanticsException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException
          • goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions.ParserException
            • goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions.InvalidSemanticsException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class InvalidSemanticsException
extends ParserException
    An extension to ParserException, mimicking the behaviour of FailedPredicateException.
    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions.ParserException

        parserLexer, sourceFile

      • Fields inherited from class org.antlr.runtime.RecognitionException

        approximateLineInfo, c, charPositionInLine, index, input, line, node, token

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InvalidSemanticsException(org.antlr.runtime.FailedPredicateException fpe)
      Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, based on a FailedPredicateException.
      Main use is to print the ANTLR FPE in the same way as GOAL ISEs.
      InvalidSemanticsException(org.antlr.runtime.FailedPredicateException fpe, java.lang.String parserLexer)
      Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, based on a FailedPredicateException.
      Main use is to print the ANTLR FPE in the same way as GOAL ISEs.
      InvalidSemanticsException(InputStreamPosition source, java.lang.String ruleName, java.lang.String faultyPredicate)
      Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, indicating that some input from the user did not match the expected format.
      InvalidSemanticsException(InputStreamPosition source, java.lang.String ruleName, java.lang.String faultyPredicate, java.lang.String sourceType)
      Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, indicating that some input from the user did not match the expected format.
      InvalidSemanticsException(org.antlr.runtime.IntStream input, java.lang.String ruleName, java.lang.String faultyPredicate)
      Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, indicating that some input from the user did not match the expected format.
      InvalidSemanticsException(java.lang.String ruleName, java.lang.String faultyPredicate)
      Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, indicating that some input from the user did not match the expected format.
      Information on the location of the faulty predicate may be given later using ParserException.setInputStream(IntStream).

    • Constructor Detail

      • InvalidSemanticsException

        public InvalidSemanticsException(java.lang.String ruleName,
                         java.lang.String faultyPredicate)
        Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, indicating that some input from the user did not match the expected format.
        Information on the location of the faulty predicate may be given later using ParserException.setInputStream(IntStream).
        Parameters:
        ruleName - The rule that made the input from the user invalid.
        faultyPredicate - What the user provided that conflicts with the given rule.

      • InvalidSemanticsException

        public InvalidSemanticsException(org.antlr.runtime.IntStream input,
                         java.lang.String ruleName,
                         java.lang.String faultyPredicate)
        Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, indicating that some input from the user did not match the expected format.
        Parameters:
        input - A reference to the faulty stream, at the position of the faulty predicate. May be null, in which case the information on the location can be set later using ParserException.setInputStream(IntStream).
        ruleName - The rule that made the input from the user invalid.
        faultyPredicate - What the user provided that conflicts with the given rule.

      • InvalidSemanticsException

        public InvalidSemanticsException(InputStreamPosition source,
                         java.lang.String ruleName,
                         java.lang.String faultyPredicate)
        Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, indicating that some input from the user did not match the expected format.
        Parameters:
        source - A pointer to where in the input stream this exception originated
        ruleName - The rule that made the input from the user invalid.
        faultyPredicate - What the user provided that conflicts with the given rule.

      • InvalidSemanticsException

        public InvalidSemanticsException(InputStreamPosition source,
                         java.lang.String ruleName,
                         java.lang.String faultyPredicate,
                         java.lang.String sourceType)
        Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, indicating that some input from the user did not match the expected format.
        Parameters:
        source - A pointer to where in the input stream this exception originated
        ruleName - The rule that made the input from the user invalid.
        faultyPredicate - What the user provided that conflicts with the given rule.
        sourceType - the name of the source, typically "GOAL" or "Prolog".

      • InvalidSemanticsException

        public InvalidSemanticsException(org.antlr.runtime.FailedPredicateException fpe)
        Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, based on a FailedPredicateException.
        Main use is to print the ANTLR FPE in the same way as GOAL ISEs.
        Parameters:
        fpe - the FailedPredicateException the new exception should be based upon.

      • InvalidSemanticsException

        public InvalidSemanticsException(org.antlr.runtime.FailedPredicateException fpe,
                         java.lang.String parserLexer)
        Creates a new InvalidSemanticsException, based on a FailedPredicateException.
        Main use is to print the ANTLR FPE in the same way as GOAL ISEs.
        Parameters:
        fpe - the FailedPredicateException the new exception should be based upon.
        parserLexer - From what part of the parsing process the error came. Should be either parser or lexer.

    • Method Detail

      • getFaultyPredicate

        public java.lang.String getFaultyPredicate()
        Returns:
        What the user provided that conflicted with the rule described in ParserException.getReason().

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class ParserException
